The Rockstar engine let to make very nice work but the games get lot of size , who don´t remember the first 3D GTA games , GTA 3 or GTA Vice City for example , they get nicely addictive games for only a few giga , when you play GTA 4 for example , maded already with this new engine you can feel some little improvement on the quality of the graphics but the addictivity of the gameplay still the same as the first 3D GTAs , the firsts Max Payne games it is the same thing , the graphics gotted little improvements on this 3rd game but on the gameplay you feel the same addictivity , the difference in both cases is the game total sizes , my particular opinion it is that the engine is good but with the games getting lot of size and with that the users spending much more hard drive space to play the games  , i suggest to Rockstar try to refinate the engine if let me the expression in order to get better flexibility and quality on the games but not exagerated in size , they did nice work for a few giga on the first 3D GTAs or Max Paynes , this rpf archives must be like this ? no way around with a new type of archives that can do the work keeping quality for less size ? and the modding ... the rpf archives modding it is like a window shop with tools maded by the fans , you can look at the files but can´t touch them or very tough to create back the rpf archives working correctly on the game , why they don´t give to the fans modding tools , many games companys do it and the games are addictive enough to motivate the fans beeing enjoying possible modding work , the software houses need to have in mind that the modding to the fans is a part of the all thing about selling games and it is one more thing that keep them more close to the games work , what in anyway can´t be bad for sales ...
